getPage: Lightweight by default. `includeContent: true` only when editing sections. Use `all: true` to list.
createPage: Returns `pageId`. Sections added separately with createSection.
updatePage: Metadata only. Use updateSection for section content.
deletePage: CASCADE deletes all sections. Array param for batch. Requires `confirmed: true`.
getPost: Default: published only. Use `status: 'all'` for drafts. Use `all: true` to list.
createPost: Creates DRAFT. Use updatePost with `status: 'published'` to publish.
updatePost: For covers, set BOTH `featuredImage` AND `content.cover`. Publish/archive via status field. Requires `confirmed: true` for status changes.
getSectionTemplate: Returns schema. Use `key` as `templateKey` in createSection. Use `all: true` to list.
getSection: By `pageSectionId` for single, `pageId` for all on page.
createSection: Returns `pageSectionId` - use for updates, NOT templateId.
updateSection: `imageField` must match schema exactly: `backgroundImage`, `image`, `cover`. Content merges with existing.
deleteSection: Array param for batch. Requires `confirmed: true`.
updateNavItem: Set `visible: false` to hide without deleting.
getImage: Expand short queries: 'AI' â†’ 'artificial intelligence technology'. Use `all: true` to list.
deleteImage: PERMANENT. Requires `confirmed: true`. Check usages first.
createEntry: Creates in collection. Status defaults to draft.
deleteEntry: PERMANENT. Array param for batch. Requires `confirmed: true`.
browseImages: Specific queries: 'monstera leaf close-up' not 'plant'. Returns previews, use importImage to download.
searchWeb: mode: 'quick' for facts, 'deep' for comprehensive research.
fetchContent: Up to 10 URLs per call. Returns markdown/text.
httpGet: For external API data. Respect rate limits.
httpPost: Requires `confirmed: true`. External API submissions only.
searchTools: Search by CAPABILITY keywords ('create post', 'list pages') not content. You MUST call discovered tools.
acknowledgeRequest: Vary naturally. Match tone to request complexity.
finalAnswer: VERIFY first if user asks about status. Use relative `/uploads/...` image paths only.
